sn23.34:1.2: Venerable Rādha said to the Buddha:
sn23.34:1.3: “Sir, may the Buddha please teach me Dhamma in brief. When I’ve heard it, I’ll live alone, withdrawn, diligent, keen, and resolute.”
sn23.34:2.1: “Rādha, you should give up any desire, any greed, any desire and greed for whatever is liable to cease.
sn23.34:2.2: And what is liable to cease?
sn23.34:2.3: Form is liable to cease. You should give up any desire, any greed, any desire and greed for it.
sn23.34:2.7: Consciousness is liable to cease. You should give up any desire, any greed, any desire and greed for it.
sn23.34:2.8: You should give up any desire, any greed, any desire and greed for whatever is liable to cease.”
